CONJUGATES: idled (v) | idling (v) | idles (v) | idler (n) | idly (adv) | idleness (n)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English īdel ('empty, useless, vain'), related to Old High German ītal.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Avoiding work; lazy; not busy or occupied.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 无所事事的；闲散的；懒散的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: After the factory closed, thousands of workers were left idle.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 工厂关闭后，数千名工人失业赋闲。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of equipment, capacity, or money) Not being used or generating revenue.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （机器、资源等）闲置的；未被使用的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We need to utilize the idle servers to cut down costs.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们需要利用这些闲置的服务器来削减成本。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of an engine or motor) To run slowly while out of gear or in neutral.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （发动机或车辆）空转；怠速运转。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He left the truck to idle while he went inside the shop.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他把卡车留在那里怠速运转，自己走进了商店。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Without purpose, effect, or foundation; useless or trivial.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 徒劳的；无用的；空洞的（指言语、威胁等）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His promises turned out to be nothing more than idle threats.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他的承诺结果不过是空洞的威胁。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To pass time without working or doing anything useful.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 虚度（光阴）；无所事事地度日。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He idled away the summer afternoons reading books.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他整个夏日的午后都在阅读书籍中虚度。

REGISTER: General, covering personal status and technical operations.
